headline: Strawberry Oatmeal Breakfast Smoothie
description: This oatmeal smoothie has a deep pink color and a rich, creamy texture. It's fast, filling, and delicious — perfect for a quick on-the-go breakfast!

video.description: See how to make a rich, creamy smoothie with no dairy.
video.name: Strawberry Oatmeal Breakfast Smoothie

name: Strawberry Oatmeal Breakfast Smoothie

recipeInstructions.text: Blend soy milk, oats, strawberries, and banana in a blender until smooth. Add sugar and vanilla and blend again until smooth.

review.reviewBody: It was good, I doubled it because it says it only makes 2 servings. We ended up with 10 servings. I swapped whole milk for soy milk and it needed 6 tablespoons of sugar. I tried 2 cups of cherry berry mix instead of strawberries, Great flavors!
I used almond milk instead and no suger.i also added plain yogurt .I feel it didn't need any sugar.o ya I also added chia seeds
I added mixed berries and pineapple to the recipe. No sugar or vanilla. It's sweet enough. Great recipe! Filling too!
Loved it! Added teaspoon of vanilla extract instead of 1/2 and also 2 tablespoons of sugar, made it so much more rich!

It was pretty good! The only thing I can dock this recipe on is possibly the addition of the oats. It does add a slightly grainier texture to the smoothie, but I don't mind this personally. Some might, hence why I gave it 4 stars and not 5.
I love oatmeal , bananas and strawberries ! Delicious ! I use Oatmilk though , I can’t drink the soy milk at all , I use the unsweetened version of the oatmilk and it makes any smoothie taste great !
I added protein powder, chia seeds, skipped on the white sugar and still delicious.
Delicious! I took other reviewers’ advice and blended up the oats first. I added white beans for protein. It was really smooth and tasted like a milkshake!

This is probably the best strawberry oatmeal smoothie I've had in a long time! I don't have a powerful blender, but 1/2 a cup of oatmeal turned out to be just fine (if you blend the milk and oatmeal first, you shouldn't have a problem with graininess --or just blend the oatmeal into a powder before you add the other stuff). I tossed in a handful of spinach and used vanilla protein powder instead of vanilla and sugar, since it was a post-workout smoothie, and it tasted amazing.
Awesome, but skip vanilla extract.
I loved it, it was very easy to make!
Tasty!
Great taste. I used old fashioned oats and blended them down first then added other ingredients. Will add to recipe box. Thanks.
Drop the oats and its perfect
Very tasty and easy to make.

This was fantastic. I also ground the oats to powder first and I love the texture and flavour. I only used 1/4 cup oats ground and that's perfect for me. I also used coconut milk and then agave instead of sugar. I omitted the banana because I hate bananas. I also added a couple ice cubes. It was absolutely delicious, but I ruined it with protein powder. Starting to realize i just hate that stuff.
I absolutely loved this recipe!! As a fan of oatmeal, this smoothie is now my all time favourite!! Thanks 4 sharing this recipe!!
I used almond milk instead—it was delicious!

This is very good!!! I made 3 of them. My fiance & 10 year old daughter love it, my 4 year old son said it was really good but he didn't want his own this morning, he just wanted some pieces of the bananas & strawberries but he did say next time he will have the smoothie!! I am definitely going to make it again! I did use vanilla soymilk instead of original & I had to add a little more to thin it out a little bit because the oats made it very thick. I also cut up a little bit of banana & strawberries & placed them on top of some whip cream!!! Next time I plan on using some Chobani Vanilla Oatmilk because that is one of my favorites & I think it will be very good to!!! I definitely recommend this to whoever hasn't tried it because it really is amazing!
It was kinda bland on its own so I added cocoa nibs (blend with other ingredients in recipe) and then it was perfect and flavorful. I needed that cocoa flavor in it.

This one is good. I had vanilla almond milk, so omitted the vanilla. Like someone else I ground up the oats first to a make it a fine grain. I only had quick oats and it still tasted well. Next time I will use frozen fruits, it was a little watery with fresh fruits.
I didn’t have any strawberries so I used frozen mango instead. I added cinnamon as well because I like the flavour but didn’t add the sugar and it was delicious!

I used regular milk and didn’t add sugar. It was plenty sweet on its own. If I started again, I’d do what one of the other readers did and grind down the oats first with mortar and pestle- even with blending the oats had a funky taste.
Very good! I Didn't have the vanilla extract but sis add Kane sugar. Will definitely make again!
So good! I used blueberries and oj. Def recommend!!!!!!!!!!!!! ;) Follow me!!
I made this with no sugar and used natural sweetener (honey) and I love it!

I snuck in some frozen mixed berries, but otherwise made this exactly according to the recipe. I think it's the perfect balance of strawberry and banana. My kids don't always drink smoothies, but they liked this one a lot!
I love this smoothie! It’s refreshing and the oats portion is really filling!
so easy and delicious. I use overnight oats and add a dollop of Greek yogurt too when I have it. a great to go breakfast for me and my toddler
so easy and delicious. I use overnight oats and add a dollop of Greek yogurt too when I have it. a great to go breakfast for me and my toddler
Strawberry taste was too strong besides that it was really good
Excellent!! Taste great, easy to make and my entire family enjoyed it.
very good! i used regular milk instead of soy milk and it was delicious!
very good! i used regular milk instead of soy milk and it was delicious!
The changes I would make is the number of frozen strawberries it messed up the blender a little so I had to put them soft on the other hand that's my blender the taste was amazing.
it was pretty good!
I loved it. Instead of soy milk I used 2% milk. If you want less thick use less oats.Overall I loved it!
perfect, my family devoured it instantaneously. Thank you so much for the recipe!
It is very flavorless and watery

I've made this smoothie twice now. I used mixed berries instead of strawberries and skim milk because I had it on hand. It turned out Amazing. Loved it's so healthy. I didn't add any extra sugar. It didn't need it. The oats give it great texture.
used skim milk and left out the sugar and vanilla. Tastes excellent

I made this with some changes and it turned out delicious. First, I used water instead of milk. Yes, water. If you want to taste your ingredients, use water. Second, I blended the oats with the water before adding the other ingredients. That way, it was really ground and blended better with everything else. I added the fruit and vanilla, a large spoonful of Greek yogurt, and sugar to taste, about 3 tablespoons. I blended that thing like crazy at the end and it was very good, My husband liked it too. I know people hate it when a poster changes a recipe and then rates it, but I just had to share. And of course, you can use whatever fruit you like!
I did not make any changes it was great and I will have it again
I loved it so much
I did not add sugar to it, this smoothie is a great breakfast meal. I do not eat breakfast before work this is great to drink on my way to work! Will definitely make it again!
I did not add sugar to it, this smoothie is a great breakfast meal. I do not eat breakfast before work this is great to drink on my way to work! Will definitely make it again!

Substituted sugar with honey, used fresh instead of frozen and was enough to make two large (~20oz) glasses of smoothie!
Essential base to making smoothies, love the inclusion of oatmeal, certainly makes it a ‘hardier’ breakfast item.
So yummy and easy
good
Not enthusiastic about this recipe.Maybe it was the oatmeal. Perhaps adding other ingredients and removing the sugar would improve it. I'm glad others enjoy it. That said, it's not for me.
This was very yummy and filling! To add protein I added a scoop of vanilla protein powder and it was fantastic!
Excellent! I made as per recipe except for using regular milk instead of soy, and I skipped the sugar. I did preblend the oats which gave it a nice texture. Great way to drink a healthy breakfast!!
Best smoothie I ever had! Sooooooooooooooo good in my mouth!????????
It tastes really nice but is really thick in volume. If it wasn't for the extreme amount of thickness then it would be a 5/5.
I added peaches instead of banana. I think i'd make it again was pretty good :D
yummy.

My oldest who is 9 requested that I make this breakfast smoothie today. We are new to smoothie's so I was nervous. Especially, since it has oatmeal in it. 
She LOVED it. She even had seconds. I enjoyed it also. The texture is a little off for me but I have issues with textures. 
KID TESTED, MOTHER APPROVED ;)

Loved it. I had only a frozen banana and refrigerated strawberries, but that worked fine with the addition of a couple of ice cubes. I used only half the recommended sugar and it still tasted sweet enough for me.

I halved all ingredients because I just wanted to make one smoothie for me. I did as other reviewers suggested & blended the oatmeal before adding the other ingredients to break them up. Once you do that, nobody can tell that oatmeal is in the drink. I did not have rolled oats so used old fashioned oats. My smoothie came out very thick, I had to add more soymilk to make it drinkable, maybe because my strawberries were big. It was good, I probably will make again.
This recipe was delicious. My whole family loved it. I switched out strawberries with blueberries and it was amazing. I will definitely eat this more often.

This recipe worked as a great base for me. I didn’t have strawberries, so I used blueberries, and I don’t drink soy milk so I used coconut, other than that the first time I made it I did it pretty in line with the recipe, the second I took out the banana and added 1TBS of cocoa powder. I also halved the recipe the second time since it makes enough for two smoothies.
This was delicious - and healthy too
I enjoyed the smoothie, but was not used to the texture the oatmeal added.I reduced the amount of sweetener (sugar) and substituted agave for the sugar. Iwill definitely have it again.

I did not want to drink alcohol this 24th and with this smoothie I am happy I didn't buy rum and whiskey. Is so amazing, the only change I did was that I could not add ice to it but it still is amazing.
nothing special, I wouldn't make it again.
It was all right, but to be fair I didn't add the sugar, so that may have made it better
I did use coconut extract rather than vanilla extract, however, the best smoothie I’ve tried so far!
Quick, easy, and yummy. I added blueberries too!

This smoothie is delicious, I make it all the time! I sometimes use a frozen banana to make the smoothie colder, and have started substituting the sugar for honey, it makes it so much sweeter! Sometimes I will also add a handful of blueberries.
I didn't have any bananas so I didn't put any in and I used regular milk instead and I will make it again 10\10
I didn't use sugar, and it still came out delicious. I also used fresh strawberries and added ice, resulting in a slightly thinner smoothie.

This is yummy and easy to make. I first ground up the oatmeal as others suggested. I didn't have any strawberries so used a fresh Okanagan Peach with the frozen banana! 1/2 cup of coconut milk and 1/2 cup vanilla greek yogurt. 
Delicious!
Thank you!
I just put in 7 strawberries and 1/2 cup of vanilla exract,I would love to make it again but it was really sweet.

I doubled the recipe and made this with sweetened coconut milk because that's what I had on hand, so I omitted the sugar and vanilla. After tasting, I added a pint of blueberries and half a pint of raspberries, and 1/2 cup frozen pineapple. I also added 2-3 tsp of honey. It was absolutely delicious and very filling. Definitely a meal replacement. Kids loved it! Will make this again for sure.
Very delicious and filling. I add the milk first and then add the oatmeal, it turns out less grainy. I loved it!!

I made this smoothie by grinding the oatmeal first, as had been suggested. It did improve the smoothie, however, I was not a fan of the grainy texture. I also didn’t add sugar. Overall, this smoothie was delicious, healthy, easy, and filling, with only the one minor bad point.
It tasted really good but next time I would probably use a different brand of frozen strawberries, or freeze my own. All in all a good recipie.

I really like this recipe! My 7yo son liked it too! Although, I used Almond milk (unsweetened) and I ended up adding more almond milk to the recipe (about a 1/4 cup) and I think I would add a tad more sugar and vanilla next go round! I will make this again!
this is great
This is the first smoothie I've ever made and it was good. I used fresh strawberries and almond milk. Since I don't like drinks too cold, that worked out well. The oatmeal was just fine uncooked.
loveeeee
I added honey instead of sugar at the end!
I used whole milk as a substitute...it still came out pretty good
Turned out pretty well. I substituted Almond Milk for the Soy Milk.
This was so delicious and easy to make for one filling serving. Yum!
This is a hit for family breakfast! I double the recipe so that my husband, our two year old, and I can all have some. Everyone loves it!
Used fresh strawberries instead of frozen ones and skim milk instead of soy milk. The flavor of the oatmeal was a bit overwhelming, but the texture was fine.
No refined sugar, but used 2T honey instead.

The only change I made is I used 1/4 C steel cut oats and dry blended into a powder before adding everything. I like it because I don't notice the oatmeal that way! BTW If you use reg oatmeal then you stick to 1/2 C
Great mixture of blend in the smoothie. I didn't know oatmeal is a good mix to the smoothie!

This is now one of my two favorite breakfast smoothies! It's a fast and easy recipe, and exceptionally filling. I followed the recipe, but substituted almond milk for the soy, and a few drops of liquid stevia in place of the sugar. Amazing!
Strawberries and bananas are naturally sweet. I see no reason to add any sugar to this recipe.
Texture was off putting
Added some spoons of natural yoghurt and vanilla protein, skipped the sugar.
My whole family enjoyed this. We enjoyed the thick consistency; it was like a milkshake. Yummy!!
I've been doing this for years, but I never use sugar. I use mangos or pineapples also and organic natural apple juice. I also use coconut milk instead of soy, and a little flax seed powder. mmmmm!

Delicious! I also ground the oats into a fine powder and omitted the sugar and Vanilla since I used Vanilla Almond-Coconut milk in the recipe. The Bananas and Strawberries were sweet enough. The only small change that I did make was to add cinnamon to the mix, made it even yummier.
My opinion is this delicious smoothie is good without the added sugar. I mean, you get natural sugars from the fruits. Why add more?
I loved this. I don't like oatmeal, but blended like this
